item.name: davidh
item.message: ARM’s streams are similar to Sirta’s parameter list. For us this isn’t going to be available right now because we don’t support generating files on the fly. That would be something for this form to do in the future. For now maybe call it stream and allow them to select which types of files they want. Not sure the best way to display the file choices (maybe file pattern like “<http://AEYYMMDD.nc|AEYYMMDD.nc>” or “<http://rig_tower.YYYY-MM-DD.nc|rig_tower.YYYY-MM-DD.nc>”).

item.name: kgao9

Also maybe you should mention CORS in there somewhere, maybe in the callback part too?

item.name: kgao9
item.message: So it will be made available in the app. I made it separate for now because you're not in the building. I suppose I could group json and jsonp into one format with a note on callback. Other than symbols, site, and inst, there's not really a difference between those two query strings. I should probably combine those. Ok, I'll work on that

item.name: davidh
item.message: This way the example URLs could be generated by the app instead of static links to bikini

item.name: davidh
item.message: Cool. After a quick skim: can json and jsonp be made in to one format (json) with a note on the callback parameter saying it will be a jsonp response (similarly coded in the api)? Is there any real difference between single and multiple instrument queries? Maybe it could be combined but make the destinction by saying site and inst are optional and how they change the symbol names. This could then be shown in an example. Lastly will this be made available as one of the api routes/views?

item.name: kgao9
item.message: <@U03CHDXBN> I finished a draft for the api's documentation. <http://www.ssec.wisc.edu/~kgao/apiDocs/index.html>.

item.name: kgao9
item.message: For influx V0.8, it had a query return limit of 100000. I'd imagine it's above that now.

item.name: kgao9
item.message: Got it

item.name: davidh
item.message: Sounds good, but maybe up it to 50000 for now. Does influxdb have a query return limit? Super important since some users of the current api dont think its weird to ask for 5 years of hourly data

item.name: kgao9
item.message: <@U03CHDXBN> I'm going to initially limit the api's payload to 10000 records, and if it goes over that, I'm going to return a 413 code with a retry-after message. We can talk about what the actual payload should be when you get back.

item.name: davidh
item.message: yeah, so I think flask-cors is the way to go. It might be a little more specific to flask, but it seems just as well maintained as the other package. Also because it is tied to flask it probably gets a lot more downloads which also means more contributors and people to find bugs. It also seems to stay outside of the “view” code which is really what we should be looking for (and why Bruce made a point to tell me to do CORS stuff in the middleware)

item.name: kgao9
item.message: So I guess whichever one is easier to use and maintain, then?

item.name: davidh
item.message: crap i don’t know

item.name: davidh
item.message: hm looks like the flask-cors package has almost 400k more downloads on pypi…may be the better option
